items.text:
# Instructions

The classical introductory exercise.
Just say "Hello, World!".

["Hello, World!"][hello-world] is the traditional first program for beginning programming in a new language or environment.

The objectives are simple:

- Modify the provided code so that it produces the string "Hello, World!".
- Run the test suite and make sure that it succeeds.
- Submit your solution and check it at the website.

If everything goes well, you will be ready to fetch your first real exercise.

[hello-world]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%22Hello,_world!%22_program

####

Use the above instructions to modify the supplied files: hello_world.py
Keep and implement the existing function or class stubs, they will be called from unit tests.
Only use standard python libraries, don't suggest installing any packages.

The task is to modify the existing function `hello()` to return the string "Hello, World!" instead of "Goodbye, Mars!". 

Here is the updated code:

items.diff:
--- hello_world.py
+++ hello_world.py
@@ -1,2 +1,2 @@
 def hello():
-    return 'Goodbye, Mars!'+    return 'Hello, World!'

items.text: This function now returns the string "Hello, World!" when called. This is a simple change that involves replacing the return value of the function with the desired string.
